Reviews.Title: “Great location in rome!”
Reviews.Author: Keisi S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were doing an 18 day whirlwind trip in Europe going to see London, Paris, Berlin, and Rome. This was a great hotel! The price is perfect and the rooms are updated and modern. The man at the front desk was SUPER helpful and friendly and he showed us some great places to eat close to the hotel. We had to check out at 5am and they let us check out the night before. The location was perfect for walking to the Colosseum, the Trevi fountain, and finding a bus stop to get to the Vatican, and the location was very safe. The ac did turn off at night like the one reviewer said, but we had double windows in our room and it was deathly quiet outside for most of the night. People who live in the area do hang out on the street where the hotel is, so it is noisy during the day, but it is a big city, and everyone we ran into was very friendly. My one complaint was that two of the towels did not seem clean, but they were replaced immediately. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “See you soon Andrea.”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Crawford_81
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times, and am going hopefully in May again; I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Great for couples & solo alike, location is perfect. We got good food recommendations, I chatted football with the owner, and were one of the first visitors to stay & treat ourselves in the revamped Suite. Excellent. Brian C.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return, unhappy with experience”
Reviews.Author: libbyrae11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 7 different places (in similar price range to this hotel) over a month in Italy, and this was our last stop. It is the only place we would definitely not return to. We loved the location and the neighborhood, but that's about it. Despite the hotel being very modern (bathroom is lovely), numerous issues really marred our 3-night stay #1 - The air conditioning turns off at night (despite the denials of this by the staff) and there is no way to turn it back on. So, in September it was incredibly hot, so we had to open the windows for any air circulation while we slept. This would be fine, except for... #2 - how incredibly loud it was. Despite being on a very small street, the traffic noise goes all night, and I believe there was a police station nearby. If you live in a large city, I'm sure this won't bother you, but I live in a small city, and the noise at this hotel kept me up nearly all night. #3 - There is an overwhelming cigarette smoke smell that comes in through the air vents around 5 or 6am which is a horrible way to wake up if you are not a smoker #4 - when we complained about all these things the next morning, the lady at the desk basically said "so what" and refused to do anything about it. I gave up fighting it so as not to completely ruin my attitude at the end of our trip. Basically, this hotel reminds me much more of the type of places I stayed at as a college backpacker, paying $20/night for hostel rooms. No romance, no ambiance, very sterile and boring, in addition to the specific complaints above. It's really unfortunate, as this hotel very much hurt our experience in Rome as a whole - instead of treating it as our last wonderful stop on our great vacation, we thought of it as 3 nights to get through before we could go back home. Saddening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: frithnow
Reviews.Content: Sunset Roma is a door in the wall about a kilometre from the Coliseum. It's an easy walk. We stayed in 2 different rooms, neither with a view. The rooms are spacious and clean with good bathrooms. The airconditioning temperature was good but there is no facility for occupants to adjust it. In room 23 I found the fan noise a little obtrusive at night. Room 12 was fine. Included wifi was great and fast. Andrea's English is good and his recommendations for places to eat were spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: xm66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located quite close to a metro stop (Cavour) and only a short walk from Colosseo. You can explore most of the historical center of Rome by foot, therefore there is even no need to purchase any prepaid metrocard (I recommend just to buy a 1-euro ticket for some of the longer rides - e.g. getting to/back from Vatican). Back to the hotel itself... We had a triple room on the first floor (was it #12?). The room was large enough and was perfectly clean. Nevertheless there were some downsides due to which I cannot give it a high rating: 1) The airconditioning might be working well, but it is operated centrally (you need to call someone to adjust the temperature if it's not convenient) 2) The only window in the room faces to an external air conditioner unit with the fan forcing the hot air into the room if you open it, also the daylight in the room is quite limited by this (the second window is in the shower). 3) The beds are incredibly hard. Altogether I would give it 3 stars (for this stay), however, I decided to go for 4 stars since it might be valid just for this specific room. If there was a more comfortable/softer bed I might give it even 5* :) Btw. if you need parking, try Via Milano only two blocks from the hotel (seems to be free of charge).

Reviews.Title: “Probably our best hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: LeShann
Reviews.Content: We have spent two nights at Sunset, and still have one more, but couldn't resost sharing our positive views of the place. We travel a lot, and frankly it has been a long while since we have been happier thn expected in a hotel. We all know this sad feeling that a hotel doesn't live up to its pictures. Well, not here. First, the rooms are great. For the price and location, this is tremendous value for money. The street is silent, the hotel has just been refurbished with great taste (the wood ceilings make the room, really, while the rest is simple modern but very comfy), the location is convenient with most attractions between 5 and 20 min walking distance (you can find more central, but not at that price and for this quality), and the staff is incredibly nice and helpful. Plus wifi internet is free, almost a rarity these days... This is the kind of hotel you always hope you end up in, reasonably priced, well located, with a great service, but without sacrificing service or decor in the room. We would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a hotel in Rome for less than 100€.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, super clean, good quality-price”
Reviews.Author: NicoLON01
Reviews.Content: I come to this hotel every time I travel to Roma. It is simply perfect. Godd price, clean rooms, fantastic location. Breakfast is not provided, but you can easily have a good cappuccino, a croassaint and a juice for 5 euro in a nearby coffee bar. I often advice this hotel to friends and relatives too, they have always been extremely happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cray11
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Sunset Hotel, the rooms & bathrooms are clean & updated. It is in a great location, within walking distance from train station, close to all the major sites, Coliseum, Trevi, Pantheon, etc.. Pizza, Gelato, Markets and Restuarants nearby. Safe and quiet area with polite and helpful staff. Would recommend as a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “location location location just a stroll to the coleseum”
Reviews.Author: sagreatdan
Reviews.Content: Great location just an easy stroll to the coleseum and other major sites. Not a bad walk for younger people from the train station. Nice area with many restaurants, good recommendations from the hotel staff as to where to eat. Felt like we were eating in restaurants that weren't just full of tourists. The room was well appointed and had a modern style, very spacious. Comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The only down side of this hotel was a bad cigarette smoke smell came into the room in the mornings, believe it came through the vents. Stayed in room 11. Otherwise i can't say a bad word about our stay of 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “THEFT ALERT! DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: udon_indigo
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, we checked into Hotel Sunset Roma for 4 nights at the Suite on L1. On the day of the arrival, there was a confusion about our booking and no one was avaliable at the counter (we rarely see anybody at the counter through out our stay) - we had to stand at the lobby for 30 minutes before they sort it out. But that was just the beginning. Our hotel room was broken into the last night of our stay. We lost 2 laptops, cash in our wallets ($2000) and my PASSPORT. The fishy part is that no doors or windows were broken. Hotel rooms use electronic access cards to go in, there are only 3 cards avaliable - we had 2 and the owner had the other one. We requested to see the survaliance camera video but was denied by the owner Andrea - as he claimed that the footage was stored with the survaliance company and he was not authorized to show it to us. We reported the case to local police and was told that there was NO video avaliable as the survaliance camera was BROKEN for awhile! After this happen, Andrea informed us that his hotel is fully booked for the next couple days so we are on our own - eventhough this took place in his hotel, eventhough we have no money, no passport - we are on our own. I do not want to get into the details what happened afterwards. I just want to say this has been the worst experience I've ever had. Completely ruined my family vacatino and our memory of Rome. I would avoid this hotel at all cost. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for site seeing”
Reviews.Author: travelmg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently - the hotel wad in a great location. Safe area, clean, next to good places to eat, and 10 min to the colosseum and 15 min to the Trevi fountain. The front desk person is only there when you check in, so make sure you ask all your questions and get his restaurant recommendations when you check in. The rooms were a decent size, the tv has lots of English channels, and the bathroom was big and very clean. Make sure to bring your own shampoo ( was not a fan of theirs). The only negative of the room was that the beds were way to firm for me and the temp in the room was warm at night. It was about $ 230/ night.... The most expensive of our Italy trip. But Rome is a bit more expensive in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: gattocane
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we encountered during our three week stay in Italy. Not only was it a great price, centrally located with extremely helpful staff but the room included amenities that travelers need- plenty of storage, very roomy, hangers, convenient light switches, plenty of air conditioning, etc. Check out the bulletin boards in the lobby with guest's raves.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: alb76ri
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean! The room was on the second floor, no elevators, so if you have a lot of luggage be prepared. This hotel has sky TV, so if you want some down time you can watch. Its a great location to the colessum as other posts have said. No room service. Beds are firm, but very clean. The owner is very helpful in suggesting places to eat etc. No parking, its on a one way street, good luck finding parking if you do have a car. Very good price for the accomendations.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: cgfer
Reviews.Content: excellent service, the woner is so nice and he gave us a lot of suggestions/good tips! the position is perfect in the center of the city: 2 minutes from colosseo, 10 minutes from fontana di trevi, really good! the rooms are well decorated: simply and really classy! and very very clean! the perfect place to stay in rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wow -- fabulous accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller70
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend this accommodation more highly for solo travellers or couples. It's guest house, not a hotel -- so there's no restaurant (you don't need one, there are plenty close by), rooms are new and perfect (large bathroom, LCD TV, high speed WiFi, top security), and the owner perosnally greets you and gives you a map of the area and any help you need at any time. He is awesome and helped me arrange my own day trip to Pompeii, as well as advice on which sights to see in which order in Rome. I walked absolutely everywhere from here - Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Vatican City, Piazza Navona, etc. I arrived late at night and walked from the train station -- I recommend you get a cab! Not fun dragging your suitcase along cobblestones late at night. Very safe area and as a single female I felt completely safe walking alone in the middle of the night in the neighbourhood of the guesthouse. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scruffy05
Reviews.Content: Great location right by the Colosseum, and the Vittorio Emmanuel Monument, however there is significant street noise on the road below. That being said, if you close the shutters you basically cut out almost all of the noise. Also, while the rooms are listed as with a 'view of the Colosseum, the only way to actually see it is to be suspended outside the window by a stick. You have to lean way out and look down the street. Get over it; you are in Rome.... the hell you doing in your room anyways? Follow the directions and recommendations of the front desk staff, they know what they are talking about. Also, pack light; this is Italy- Elevators happen to other countries.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutley fantastic hotel! Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: Linda583
Reviews.Content: Wow what a find! This hotel was so wonderful! Everything was very new and the rooms were kept extremely clean. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was situated just a few 100m from the Collesseo-fantastic location! I highly recommend staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Six blocks from the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBarabas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what many in the U.S.A. would categorize as a "boutique" hotel. There is not a full-time receptionist or a breakfast served. Having said that, this place is awesome for travelers exploring Rome and using the hotel as a place to shower and lay their heads. It is clean, modern, air-conditioned, traveler-friendly, and in the middle of it all. Hostess "Anna" speaks fantastic English and took time to provide us with a map, suggest restaurants and attractions, and provide directions to Rome. Looking out our window and down the street we saw the Colosseum six blocks in the distance. There can be no better value in Rome. I will look no further when my journeys bring me back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: meischad1
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the lack of public areas, breakfast, and hotel reception, this is a very nice place to stay. Rooms were clean and modern and quiet. We liked the location on via dei Serpenti.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WAVictoria
Reviews.Content: This is a "bad news/GREAT NEWS" review. First the bad news; as indicated in a previous review, Hotel Sunset is more of a "Guest House" than a full-services hotel. There's no elevator, no lobby to speak of, very little of the North American-style 24 hour services and, depending where your room is situated, early morning traffic can be a factor. The GREAT NEWS? A GREAT LOCATION, close to the ancient sections of Rome. (10 minutes to the Colosseum & Forum - other sites branch out from there) & close to the Metro (10-15 minutes depending on the line selected.) The Gelato shop just down the street is incredible as is the nearby Coffee Bar. The staff are personable & helpful, the hotel is spotless & our room was spacious, comfortable & clean We stayed on the second floor facing Via Dei Serpenti. Andreas helped us with our luggage up the narrow stairs & then helped us get oriented to the main sights. We weren't prepared for the early morning garbage/recycling collection but my trusty ear plugs fixed that problem. Besides, we easily traded that off to open our window, look down the street & see the Colosseum! Another reviewer commented that the desk is not staffed often but guests are usually exploring the sites or sleeping off the exhaustion caused by walking about the ancient city. Besides that, someone was a phone call away & help was not far behind. Do yourself a favour, check out this unassuming beauty near the heart of Ancient Rome! If you choose to stay here, try contacting the hotel directly to save third-party booking fees.

Reviews.Title: “great location, no problems”
Reviews.Author: alkirisits
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other posts re the location. The collesium and roman forum are a 10 min walk down the street. The metro station is about 15 min walk. There are many nice cafes for breakfast and small, local restaurants for supper. The desk person recomendations were very enjoyable. I took the leonardo express from the airport to the main rail station, the stazione termini (11 euro). you can buy a roma pass at the station info desk that includes a three day pass on the bus and metro system. The taxi to the hotel was 10 euro, but I could have taken the via natione bus in front of the station to via del serpenti, where the hotel is, for free with the pass. There is no sign on the hotel entrance, look for 97. The room was modern, clean and quiet at night. i would stay again here

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms, if you don't mind the absence of staff”
Reviews.Author: brufig
Reviews.Content: The Sunset is very modern, but I wouldn't call it a Hotel, as there are almost no services available. It's more like a guest house. Most of the time the reception desk is empty with a note for guests that if they need help, they should use the reception phone to call someone. When indeed there's someone there, they are friendly and helpful. The room was huge, recently refurbished, comfortable, with a huge TV with lots of channels (most of them you could change to english audio). The biggest problem with our room was that there were no windows in the bedroom itself, only in the children's side bedroom and bathroom. And those windows had views to the service court. Not that I minded all that much but a view is always nice. Other than that the only issues we had were with the uncontrollable and hard as nails shower. And mind you, you can't adjust the AC yourself, you have to call the staff to have it changed. The Sunset is in an awesome location, very safe day and night, with lots of nice and inexpensive restaurants around. It's within walking distance of, well, everything worth seeing in Rome (you can even see the Coliseum at the end of the street).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: minisjen
Reviews.Content: As stated in so many other reviews, the location of the Sunset is ideal for traveling around Rome on foot. The Colosseum was visible from the window in our room, and every other major attraction was within easy walking distance, although I would recommend taking the #64 bus to the Vatican (just to get there early in the morning to avoid all the people), then walking back. There are a number of fantastic restaurants in the area, and if you're looking for a change from Italian-style food, the Mother India restaurant just down the road is HIGHLY recommended! We were in Rome for seven nights, and ate there for dinner once, and lunch a number of times. We did have a number of concerns with the hotel itself though: 1. Unwelcome visitors: A friend happened to be traveling in Rome at the same time, so we planned to meet at the Sunset for a couple of drinks, then go out for dinner. We were told that only the guests were allowed in the rooms, and there seemed to be veiled threats that the police would be called if we tried to bring him up. There is no lobby, no meeting place in the hotel, so even just to meet our friend, we would have had to wait out on the street. 2. Transportation recommendations from the staff: The Sunset Hotel website boasts that the hotel is easy walking distance from the train station. The train runs directly from the Termini station to the departures area at Fuimicino Airport. Upon checkout, the staff asked us how we planned to travel to the airport. We had researched costs, and decided that the train would be easiest/cheapest. Hearing this, the staff recommended that we take a taxi to the airport, and more than double the cost. He then tried to get us to take a taxi to the Termini station, making us wonder if he was getting kickbacks from the cab company. RECOMMENDATION: walk from the hotel to the Termini station (it took us 10minutes even with our suitcases) 3. Restaurant recommendations from the staff: The one restaurant recommended to us was the worst food we had during our entire stay. We are very adventurous eaters, not picky at all, but the food was bland, greasy and not up to our expectations based on other restaurants in the area. Eat at Mother India instead - fantastic food and wonderful service. If we are able to return to Rome, we will stay at the Sunset again, but ONLY because of it's ideal location for a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sunset, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: happybabes
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Sunset last week after a 5 day stay. As many reviewers commented on TA, the hotel is in an excellent location tucked away in a side street near a small fountain square with many restaurants close by. No breakfast or tea/coffee making facilities but we knew that before we arrived at it didn't cause us any problems. There is a small mini bar in the room which is not too expensive. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the beds made up and room tidied on a daily basis. It can be a little noisy at night however the shutters and double glazing does the trick. the owner is very hepful on arrival giving you a good map and pointing out all the main attractions and telling you how to get there. If you need him throughout your stay there is a telephone at reception where you can phone and he will be there in minutes to help you. Most are within walking distance apart from the Vatican where you can get a number 40 or 64 bus there in about 20min. We bought the Roma Pass at Termini for 22 euros each but because we stayed so centrally to everything we didn't have much use for it. Although you can use if for discounts to museums etc the first 2 being free and discounted after that. So if you use if for the first 2 then you've got your money back. Don't forget to take the actual Roma Card to the museum and not the Ticket as we forgot to take this with us and had to pay to get into the colleseum so we lost out on that one! Thought the tickets themselves would have been enough. We were dissappointed with the Spanish Steps at the moment as there were no flowers or anything on them. You normally see them on all the photographs. Maybe we were too early for them. We took £400 worth of euros from Monday afternoon till Friday morning and had to lift out another 200 euros. We found food and drinks expensive. Watch out for high prices on the main street leading up the vatican. A lovely pizza restaurant charges us 14 euros for a calzone pizza, and 22 euros for a half bottle of wine and a beer. Waiters are all in a uniform so if you're on a strict budget, find another restaurant further back. Weather was brill 32 degrees on the first day although on the Thursday it was very wet until late afternoon but it did brighten up quite quickly. I haven't mentioned much about the places we visited as I know there are loads of other reviews on this, so thought I would just give comments on some of the other things. If I can help with any questions on the hotel or anything else, let me know, but I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “could not ask for a beter location”
Reviews.Author: scotty30
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome with my Girlfriend for my 30th loved the place. This Hotel, is based in a fantisic loaction, walking distance from almost everything. big clean modern room. Cheap resturants outside on quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Rome...”
Reviews.Author: bigmac1970
Reviews.Content: As with other travellers we thought we'd carry out some reasearch about Rome and where to stay....well we found this little gem and it is quite simply an amazing 'guest house' wouldn't call it a Hotel as it is a reception desk with rooms, but don't let this put you off beutifuly decorated throughout private, quite and safe. Beautiful location and more importantly central..to all the sites and the owner Andreas will give you a map and take you through the various sites and best buses to catch, etc. On the same street is a bank, with ATM about half a dozen small restaurants (avoid the chinese La Pace not good!) The remaining restaurants very good and reasonably priced expect to pay about 25 Euros (2 courses 1/2ltr carafe of house wine - surprising good wine for only 4 Euros if your interested it was Fruscati vino) Tubacci shop - sells cigs and does a nice morning cup of cappichino and pastries, lovelly ice cream shop sells icecream from 9am - 11pm!! Even if you are only in Rome for a few days as we were I would recommend the following sites: Vatican catch the No 64 bus we were warned about pick pockets but had no problems, felt safe albeit a bit squashed in the bus - free entry (expect a donation) pay the extra charge and go in to the treasury to view the whole of Rome from the top of St. Peters. Collesuem - breathtaking cost 11 Euros or slightly more for guided/audio tour see so much more than just from the outside and you get entry into Palatino included (Roman ruins alongside) picturesque walk Not for the faint hearted (you have been warned) but very interesting Saint Maria della Concezione church (bones musuem) located in Via Vittorio venete, basically 4,000 monks bones have been sculpted into various scenes (clock & lampshades) if your interested - beware the church is closed between 12 - 3pm. If you're interested in a guide book would recommend the Eyewitness Travel for Rome, really useful with bus/metros stops and information about each sector of Rome...Amazon books are offering around £11 including deliver at the time of writing. If you are booking seperately and not a package holiday would recommend Terravision 20 Euros return to ferry you from the Airport and the Termini bus/train station (you can do it via the local buses that are cheaper) but we found this nice and straighforward for first time travellers to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Blewnoser
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location for those travelling light. It was a level 15 minute walk to the Termini station where we got off the airport express train. If you stuck your head out the window and looked left you could see the Coliseum about 6 blocks away. The room was modern but still had nice wood beams, and very clean and comfortable with a large TV and phone. There is a fantastic cheap Internet facility about two doors away and good restaurants in the same block - try the Dodo - we ate there twice. Avoid the one next door to it.) A short walk to the Trevi fountain too. The price was very reasonable for Rome and the neighbourhood seemed safe late into the evening. Excellent multi-paned windows to block out the city noise. Quite a few stairs to get to the room but very good security.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for walking around town”
Reviews.Author: Pierre and Nicole
Reviews.Content: A snug hotel set in what felt like a village in a valley in the centre of the city, and the local restaurants were just great. We were able to roll our cases there pretty easily from the railway station and we found the Colleseum and Palatime just over the brow of the hill. Room was spacious and bathroom modern. Buses to St. Peters nearby, shops and cafes not too distant. If we lived in Rome we would live in this area and we do recommend the friendly, "we care what you think" atmosphere at the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: KJS_1234
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sunset is a lovely place to stay if you want to be on a quite street, just off Via Nationale (noisy, busy). It is very close to the Colosseum and in walking distance of everything except the Vatican. Rooms are very clean and modern, a bit small with firm beds, but that is the the norm in Italy. Great windows blocked out any noise from the street. Like other visitors the hotel is more like an apartment complex, however Andrea is available when ever you may need his assistance. Given other prices of hotels in Rome, this is a nice, clean, safe, good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jessiethecat
Reviews.Content: Our visit started badly when we discovered we had been conned by a cab-driver who had marked his car as a taxi, told us he was a taxi, but then tried to charge limousine rates. Having sorted him out in no uncertain terms, Andrea, the charming patron of the Sunset hotel, then took us under his wing, and proved to be a fund of useful information and guidance. His best advice was to use the coffee bar just down the street for breakfast - absolutely superb coffee and pastries, and a wonderful way to meet the locals, who throng there. We had the room up the glass staircase, with good air-conditioning. Being at the back it was also very quiet - you could hardly believe you were in the centre of Rome. The bathroom was smart and well equipped, and we did not have any of the problems with hot water described in an earlier review. The hotel is very well-placed for much of the city, although it's a bit of a hike to the Vatican City . But the Roman forum is just down the road, as are the Colosseum and the Palatine Hill., while the over-visited Trevi fountain is also within easy distance. A great place to stay for anyone wanting to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: PuertoRicoOlympicFan
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research and chose the Sunset taking into account previous traveler reviews plus our perception of value for money. For a 3-star hotel, the Sunset is an excellent choice. We would go back any time. Andrea is very helpful and runs a very neat operation. Our room was in a second level via a beautiful glass-floor spiral staircase. The location is excellent, close to all principal sites but at the same time in a quiet spot. Also very safe with a carabinieri station on the same street. The rooms have been recently refurbished with nice decor. Split-unit A/C worked very well. I only missed SportsCenter as the TV has only CNN in English. Next time we will book directly with Andrea as he suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HollyandMark
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sunset was a small but charming hotel about 5 minutes from the Colosseum. Our room was quiet despite having a view onto the street and had good air conditioning and was nicely furnished. As it was small the front desk was informal and most of the time it felt like we were staying in an apartment in the city. There were some colourful local eateries nearby, including a lovely one which was recommended by the helpful staff when we arrived, as well as a brilliant Gelaterie. We would gladly go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcomed friends”
Reviews.Author: fmc208
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 1/2kms from the train station so an easy walk. We were welcomed and helped up the two flights of stairs to our room. The room was large with a good size bathroom. We had friends staying at another hotel and invited them to join us about 6.30pm - we were told we were not allowed guest unless prior organised with the owners - we were allowed to have visitors for half an hour on this occassion. The next night I advised the owner that our two friends were meeting us at our hotel before dinner - we were advised that this was against their policy and my friend could stay only 5 minutes. I found this most unusual.The trouble is that this hotel has no lobby or any other place to meet friends. I was travelling with my daughter of 16years and neither of us were able to have a long enough hot shower to be able to remove the shampoo and conditioner in our hair. The last morning we were leaving at 7.15 am and the first shower of 3 minutes was luke warm and my daughters shower was cold we were leaving for a 26 hour flight home that day!! The location of this hotel is very good but the two problems above gave us a very negative and unwelcome feeling in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, can see colliseum from the window”
Reviews.Author: Erica_from_NY
Reviews.Content: Probably the coolest thing about this hotel is that if you stick your head out the window and look to the left, you can see the colliseum right down the street (a 10-minute walk). The location is great, with easy access to Roman forum area and buses that take you to other sites. They were undergoing some renovations while we were there, but it wasn't very noisy at all. The lack of air conditioning was a bit uncomfy, but the room itself was clean and had a comforting rustic vibe to it. Oddly, the bathroom was very modern. The owner was friendly and helpful. Definitely take him up on his gelato place recommendation. It was the best I had in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: flowerwatersun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Walkable to the Colosseum and other major attractions. You can catch the major buses a block away from the hotel on one of the main streets. The hotel is located on a very safe street and the rooms are clean. The manager/owner, Andres, was very friendly and helpful. Even though we had to walk up a flight of stairs to our room, he insisted on helping us with our suitcases. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Sunset Roma Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: yeff316
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in Rome and the concierge was there to greet us. My wife and I had booked a 2 person room. At the last minute, her brother (stationed in the military over in Europe), was able to join us for the trip and planned on just staying in the bedroom with us and sleeping on the floor. Apparently, the rules in Rome do not allow for such conditions and a 2 person room means that only 2 people can occupy the room at any given time. So with night upon us, her brother had to go searching for another room in the city. The concierge provided some recommendations, but it would have been much more helpful had he been able to whip out a phonebook or something. Anyways, I don't know if this rule applies all over Rome, but I thought it was kind of ridiculous that we could not even have guests in our room for the day just to visit. Is this the case throughout Rome? Maybe they should reconsider this law? Overall, the location of the hotel was good. Very close proximity to the train station and the sites. Almost central to both. The room was clean and modern. It was actually very spacious as well. The bed was less than desirable. It felt like I was sleeping on a rock. There also wasn't any air conditioning, at least that I could find, and there was no way you could sleep with the windows open with the noise from Rome. In my opinion, there appeared to be several other accomodations in the vicinity that would be worth considering before this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tomsab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sunset for 3 days last week. We were there just passing through on our way home from a convention in Milan. Great hotel for the money. Andrea was wonderful. Always there to help whether we needed a cab or to recommend a restaurant or tips on where to go, etc. A great host! Very modern and clean room. We stayed on a ground floor room that looked like everything was brand new from the bed to the bathroom fixtures. Very quiet and centrally located to everything except the Vatican. Supposedly the president lives about 2 blocks away and there are lots of official police cars in the area so it's also very safe. We found that we could walk almost everywhere from this hotel. There is no breakfast, but Andrea knows the area very well and he was able to steer us to a few early morning cafes for a coffee and croissant. Lots of restaurants around the immediate vicinity that were all quite reasonable. The prices in Rome were much less than they were in Milan so we found the prices for dinner much more acceptable here than up north. Would definitely stay here again if we were coming through.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sunset!!”
Reviews.Author: jade83
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3night stay at Sunset Roma and we loved it. Really clean, modern and secure hotel. Good area, very close to Colosseum and Forum (5-10minutes) You can see Colosseum from hotel gate. We walked from Termini station to hotel which wasn't too bad but we got a taxi back which cost 8 euro. Man at reception was very nice and helpful, gave us a map and told us how far things were and where best places to eat were. Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona all within walking distance, only thing bit further was Vatican but you can get there on bus number 64 which stops on Via Nazionale few minutes from hotel. We had an inside room so had no noise from street. No breakfast at hotel but we prefered this as we ate while we were out. We ate at Colon II one evening which is couple of doors up from hotel, this was cheap and simple but nice enough. We would recommend 'Tre Scalini' on Piazza Navona, really lovely food. And they have the best choc chip 'Tartufo' :) Overall very nice hotel, would definatley recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: salonia2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sunset for three nights and it exceeded all expectations. When I search for hotels during travel I look at the following items: Location, price, reputation on room cleanliness. Hotel Sunset has a great location right in the center of the historic district (Colosseum, Forum) as well as a 10 min walk from the main train/bus station in Rome. All major sites are w/in a 20 min walk (Vatican is a little longer, but Rome is a great walking city). The Hotel is located in a very safe neighborhood with many fantastic cafes and restaurants. The rooms are very clean, and the showers have fantastic water pressure. No breakfast served however the best cafe in the city from the many we went to was right down the road. The hotel manager, Andrea, is a fantastic host that knows all of the ins and outs of the city with great food recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bluedormouse
Reviews.Content: The Sunset is a lovely little hotel, and very convenient for the Trevi, Spanish Steps, railway station etc. The Colosseum is just at the bottom of the road. We got a very friendly welcome, with plenty of helpful advice and a map. Our room looked as though it had just been refurbished, and was very clean and attractive. Unfortunately, the room next door was still being refurbished, and this was the only downside of what could have been a perfect stay. We'd requested a quiet room, but we were woken up by loud hammering and scraping next door. Even when we tried to go for a siesta the noise continued. Sadly, this meant that we've come home feeling as though we need a holiday! I'd fully recommend the Sunset, but only when the building work is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Hotel, Nice Service”
Reviews.Author: Matsufatsu
Reviews.Content: Andres provided great service while we were at the hotel. We stayed in Rome and Florence and by far this was the cleanest place. In a nutshell, would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of cleanliness and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Hosta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in early October 2006. Although fascinating, the pace of life in Rome can be overwhelming to the traveler. The Sunset was an oasis of calm. We had a large, quiet room away from the street. The location was very convenient to many major sites so we did a lot of walking. We also came back for a siesta in the afternoons, which made our stay in Rome more manageable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: alirae
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching hotels in Rome in the Collesium area as we were only there for 2 days and wanted to be close to the major attractions. I stumbled upon the Sunset suites and for the $$ it was the best hotel I had seen. We paid 150 euros for a triple room on Friday and Sat night. The hotel had offered to have a driver to pick us up for 50 euros but we had declined figuring that it would be more money than a taxi at the airport. We regret this decision as it was cheaper and way more comfortable than the city cabs. We paid 80 euro for the city cab and when we arrived and gave him the money, he pocketed 20 euros and told us we didn't pay him enough. Be aware that you need to count the money out to these drivers. The driver was also crazy driving at speeds close to 190 km/hr and then he almost got in a fight with another driver on the freeway. On the way back we took the hotel up on there driver and we had a relaxing drive in a nice mercedes car. We arrived at the Sunset to the nicest check-in person. I had read many reviews about how rude italian hotel staff people can be. He was anything but....he checked us in and gave us a map of the area, told us where to eat and gave us a lot of helpful tourist tips! The bathroom was awesome...really big and brand new. The rooms were very clean and quiet. I would totally recommend the sunset townhouse in Rome. It was the cheapest one that I found in the area and it was the best in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MKALouisville_KY
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we chose this hotel and we are so glad that we did. This hotel offers the best of everything. The rooms are clean and new-looking as is the furniture. Lots of storage. We had booked a twin room but instead Andreas gave us a large room with two twin beds, another small room with one twin bed, and a large bathroom. I thought that it was better than most American hotels. Andreas kept apologizing for giving us an interior room but it had a larger bathroom than the ones with a view. Andreas was a great host too - very helpful with recommendations, directions, and other helpful hints. There is a centralized DVD system, so that is nice if you have kids. Lots of little nice touches (e.g., the lights are on motion detector so they come on as you go around the hotel). Location was great too. We walked to the coliseum the first evening (in about 5-7 minutes) and the view was breathtaking. Close to lots of nice restaurants and Gelato shop). We walked to Trevi in about 15 minutes. We liked not having the breakfast at the hotel and much preferred having it at our own schedule at a nearby coffee shop where they had fresh croissants and wonderful cappuccino. I would stay there again without looking anywhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sunset
HotelInfo.Address: Via Dei Serpenti 97, 00184 Rome, Italy
